TopicTitle: Are kerbals an offshoot of the antigravity minion?

Articles.Content:
Just curious, but wouldn't it be cool if the kerbal's could trace their lineage back to that anti gravity minion from despicable me that floated out into space. After flying in space for so long they turned green and gained proper eyesight. Always wondered what happened to all those minions that flew off into space, seems like this is the answer.

Just thought i'd share that.
Wouldn't we have antigravity Kerbals then rather than Jumbo tanks and mainsails?
the antigravity minion was their jesus, he inspired them to start their space program

After flying in space for so long they turned green and gained proper eyesight.

Why would being in space for an extended period do this?

Why would being in space for an extended period do this?

Maybe they developped photosynthesis and the ones that didn't died?

That would explain why Kerbals can survive so insanely long in space.
I always thought Kerbals were evolutionary relatives of the muppets!
Nope. 14th Lost Tribe of the Incredible Hulks.

Kerbals are fungi. You can easily tell this because when they die, they explode in a cloud of spores like a puffball. In fact, on Kerbin, the standard euphemism for an astronaut dying isn't "he passed away", but "he released his spores".
